item.name: Higher Education and Workforce Development Subcomittee

item.title: Community College Energy Training Act of 2009

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5714)

item.name: Higher Education and Workforce Development Subcomittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education, Lifelong Learning, and Competitiveness.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]
Resident Commissioner Pierluisi, Pedro R. [D-PR-At Large]
Del. Faleomavaega, Eni F. H. [D-AS-At Large]

summary.text:
Community College Energy Training Act of 2009 - Directs the Secretary of Energy, in coordination with the Secretary of Labor, to create a program awarding grants to community colleges to provide workforce training and education in sustainable energy industries and practices, such as: (1) alternative energy; (2) energy efficient construction, retrofitting, and design; (3) sustainable energy technologies; (4) water and energy conservation; (5) recycling and waste reduction; and (6) sustainable agriculture and farming.

Requires at least one-half of the grant funds to be awarded to community colleges with existing sustainability programs leading to certificates or degrees in one or more of the industries or practices listed above.

bill.title: Community College Energy Training Act of 2009

item.title: Community College Energy Training Act of 2009
To require the Secretary of Energy, in coordination with the Secretary of Labor, to establish a program to provide for workforce training and education, at community colleges, in sustainable energy.
Community College Energy Training Act of 2009

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education, Lifelong Learning, and Competitiveness.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
